problem.tex: Let $f:D\to\mathbb{C}$ be a nonconstant holomorphic function on the unit disc. Assume $f(0)=1$ and $Re(f(z))\geq0$. Prove that for all $|z|\leq1$, \[|f(z)|\leq\frac{1+|z|}{1-|z|}.\]

solution.tex: Because $Re(f)\geq0$ for all $z\in D$, we know that $f$ maps into the right half plane. Take a Mobius transformation which sends $1$ to $0$ and sends the right half plane to the unit disc. $m(z)=\frac{z-1}{z+1}$ works. Then look at \[m\circ f:D\to D.\] By construction, $m(f(0))=m(1)=0$. Thus the Schwarz lemma gives that for all $z\in D$, \[|m(f(z))|\leq|z|\] \[\left|\frac{f(z)-1}{f(z)+1}\right|\leq|z|\] \[|f(z)-1|\leq|zf(z)+z|\] \[|f(z)|-1\leq|f(z)-1|\leq|zf(z)+z|\leq|zf(z)|+|z|\] \[|f(z)|-|zf(z)|\leq1+|z|\] \[|f(z)|(1-|z|)\leq1+|z|\] \[|f(z)|\leq\frac{1+|z|}{1-|z|}.\]
